raw.title: [ARFC] Onboard sUSDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
---
### [ARFC]  Onboard sUSDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum 

### Author:  ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)

### Date: 2024-04-01

---

### **Summary**

This is an ARFC to seek approval for the addition of sUSDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum, following the consensus reached in the [TEMP CHECK](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x3263dbee34f5afe513a1a6c5bcd5207684cee03473e1b3d7616993dbd87ab881) stage.

### **Motivation**

As discussed in the TEMP CHECK, Ethena's synthetic dollar, USDe, provides a stable crypto-native solution for a cash and carry structured product. The staked version of USDe, sUSDe, earns yield from the protocol and has high potential for strong borrow demand. 

### **Specification**

sUSDe: [0x9d39a5de30e57443bff2a8307a4256c8797a3497](https://etherscan.io/token/0x9d39a5de30e57443bff2a8307a4256c8797a3497)

### Risk Parameters

Risk parameters have been provided by Chaos Labs in the ARFC discussion thread. 

Initial Risk Parameters are the following:

| Parameter | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | Yes |
| Borrowable | No |
| Collateral Enabled | Yes |
| Supply Cap (sUSDe) | 85M |
| Debt Ceiling |40M |
| LTV | 72.00% |
| LT | 75.00% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 8.50% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00%|
|Flashloanable|No|
|Siloed Borrowing|No|
|Borrowed in Isolation|No|
|Emode|No|

### **Useful Links**

[TEMP CHECK](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-onboard-susde-to-aave-v3-on-ethereum/16840)
[TEMP CHECK Snapshot](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x3263dbee34f5afe513a1a6c5bcd5207684cee03473e1b3d7616993dbd87ab881)

### Disclaimer

This proposal is powered by Skywards. The Aave Chan Initiative is not directly affiliated with Ethena and did not receive compensation for creation this proposal.

### **Next Steps**

1. Collect community & service providers feedback on this ARFC.
2. Escalate the proposal to ARFC snapshot stage if feedback is positive.
3. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)

---
Title: [ARFC] Onboard USDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum 
Date: 2024-05-13
Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)
---

### Summary:

This is an ARFC to seek approval for the addition of USDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum, as there’s been already a successful onboarding for sUSDe (staked USDe)  on Ethereum.

### **Motivation**

Ethena’s synthetic dollar, USDe, provides a stable crypto-native solution for a cash and carry structured product. The staked version of USDe, sUSDe, earns yield from the protocol and has high potential for strong borrow demand, which was already onboarded successfully into Aave. 

The current ARFC plans to onboard USDe on Aave v3 Ethereum.

### **Specification**

USDe: (0x4c9edd5852cd905f086c759e8383e09bff1e68b3)
[Etherscan link](https://etherscan.io/token/0x4c9edd5852cd905f086c759e8383e09bff1e68b3)

### Risk Parameters

ARFC has been updated with Risk parameters provided by Risk Service Providers in the ARFC discussion thread.

| Parameter | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | Yes |
| Borrowable | Yes |
| Collateral Enabled | Yes |
| Supply Cap (USDe) | 80M |
| Borrow Cap (USDe) | 72M |
| UOptimal | 80% |
| Slope1 | 9.00% |
| Slope2 | 75.00% |
| Debt Ceiling | $40M |
| LTV | 72.00% |
| LT | 75.00% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 8.50% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00% |

### **Useful Links**

[[TEMP CHECK] Onboard sUSDe to Aave v3 Ethereum](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-onboard-susde-to-aave-v3-on-ethereum/16840)

[[ARFC] Onboard sUDe to Aave v3 on Ethereum](https://governance.aave.com/t/arfc-onboard-susde-to-aave-v3-on-ethereum/17191/6)

### Disclaimer

This proposal is powered by Skywards. The Aave Chan Initiative is not directly affiliated with Ethena and did not receive compensation for creation this proposal.

### **Next Steps**

1. Collect community & service providers feedback on this ARFC.
2. Escalate the proposal to ARFC snapshot stage if feedback is positive.
3. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### Copyright

raw.title: [ARFC] Deploy Aave v3 on Sonic
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## [ARFC] Deploy Aave v3 on Sonic

## Author: ACI

## Date: 2025-01-07
-----

>Risk Parameters have been provided by Service Providers and this section has been updated 2025-01-30

## Simple Summary:

This ARFC seeks the community’s input on the deployment of Aave V3 on Sonic Mainnet.

## Background:

Sonic is a new Layer 1 EVM blockchain offering 10,000 TPS and fee monetization for app builders. It is the newest blockchain from the creators of Fantom which reached a peak TVL of circa $14.5 billion in 2021. 

## Motivation

Aave has deployed on multiple promising new L1 and L2 EVM networks and is often one of the largest protocols on these networks. Given the impressive history of the team building Sonic, and the innovations it promises, it represents a strong candidate for deployment of Aave V3. In addition, the fee monetization for apps has potential to be an additional income source for Aave.

## Proof of Liquidity (POL) and Deposit Commitments:

The Sonic Foundation will provide the following, upon its deployment is confirmed:

- 15M USD Funding from Sonic
- 800k USD stablecoins from Aave
- Up to 50M $S tokens Supply
- 20M of USDC Supply


## Specification:

Risk Parameters have been provided by Service Providers and this section has been updated 2025-01-30

| Parameter |  |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Asset | WETH | wS | USDC.e |
| Isolation Mode | No | No | No |
| Enable Borrow | Yes | Yes | Yes |
| Enable Collateral | Yes | Yes | Yes |
| Loan To Value | 80% | 35% | 75% |
| Liquidation Threshold | 83% | 40% | 78% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 6% | 10% | 5% |
| Reserve Factor | 15% | 20% | 10% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10% | 10% | 10% |
| Supply Cap | 400 | 3,000,000 | 2,000,000 |
| Borrow Cap | 370 | 1,500,000 | 1,900,000 |
| Debt Ceiling | - | - | - |
| UOptimal | 90% | 45% | 90% |
| Base | 0% | 0% | 0% |
| Slope1 | 2.7% | 7% | 12.5% |
| Slope2 | 80% | 300% | 40% |
| Stable Borrowing | No | No | No |
| Flashloanable | Yes | Yes | Yes |
| Siloed Borrowing | No | No | No |
| Borrowable in Isolation | No | No | Yes |
| E-Mode Category | N/A | N/A | N/A |

## Disclaimer:

This proposal is powered by Skywards. The ACI is not directly affiliated with  Fantom or Sonic and did not receive any compensation for creating this proposal. 

## Useful Links

[[TEMP CHECK] Deploy Aave v3 on Sonic](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-deploy-aave-v3-on-sonic/20259) 

[TEMP CHECK Snapshot](https://snapshot.box/#/s:aave.eth/proposal/0xdad0834b0a2b0b9b5b48688f58f1f0e5c75f7a17185975dbbeeb88f558dd65b2)

## Next Steps

1. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage.
2. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

## Copyright:

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

cleaned.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard & Enable LBTC/WBTC liquid E-Mode on Aave v3 Core Instance
cleaned.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193

raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard & Enable LBTC/WBTC liquid E-Mode on Aave v3 Core Instance
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## Author: @ACI
## Date: 2024-11-28

---


# **Summary**

This proposal aims to onboard and enable LBTC/WBTC (Lombard) liquid E-Mode for the Main Instance. By implementing this change, we seek to enhance capital efficiency for borrowers using LBTC/WBTC as collateral.

# **Motivation**

The motivation behind this proposal stems from several key factors:

- High Utilization: LBTC/WBTC has demonstrated significant usage as collateral for borrowing stablecoins on other platforms.
- Capital Efficiency: Enabling liquid E-Mode for LBTC/WBTC will allow borrowers to substantially improve their capital efficiency when using this asset as collateral.
- Controlled Growth: Liquid E-Mode provides a mechanism for more precise control over the growth and borrow demand in relation to the overall stablecoin liquidity within Aave v3 on Core Instance.

By implementing this proposal, we aim to optimize the use of LBTC/WBTC within the Aave ecosystem, attracting more liquidity for the protocol and increasing revenues.

# **Specification**

This proposal will add LBTC/WBTC liquid E-Mode. Risk Parameters will be provided by Risk Service Providers and ARFC will be updated accordingly when ARFC is posted if it passes this TEMP CHECK.

## Useful links

[**BGD. Aave v3.2: Liquid Emodes**](https://governance.aave.com/t/bgd-aave-v3-2-liquid-emodes/19037) 

[**ARFC Snapshot**](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x68ce69b5e71df1d77c2ad814a5d41162a40be54473576ff590d0b1bb5afde4a7)

[**Github**](https://github.com/aave-dao/aave-v3-origin/tree/v3.2.0)

[**AIP**](https://vote.onaave.com/proposal/?proposalId=178)

# Disclaimer

This proposal is directly powered by ACI (Aave Chan Initiative). ACI did not received compensation for creation of this proposal.

# Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached on this TEMP CHECK, escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
2. If Snapshot passes, escalate to ARFC and then Snapshot.
3. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal

# Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard rstETH to Aave V3 Prime Instance
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## **[TEMP CHECK] Onboard rstETH to Aave V3 Prime Instance**

## **Author: ACI**

## **Date: 2024-12-18**

## **Summary**

This is a TEMP CHECK to gauge community sentiment for onboarding P2P’s rstETH on AAVE V3 Ethereum.

To align best with goals of all relevant stakeholders, this proposal suggests onboarding rstETH to the Aave v3 Prime instance.

## **Motivation**

rstETH is a restaking vault token built on top of Mellow and Symbiotic. It currently has over $250m in TVL and is one of the largest Mellow restaking vaults. 

Adding rstETH to the Aave v3 Prime instance brings additional synergies for all stakeholders.

rstETH will add additional demand for wstETH borrowing, making the wstETH looping more favorable for the main users. Incentives from P2P and other members of the Symbiotic and Mellow ecosystem can bring additional wstETH liquidity to the Prime instance, bolstering the existing liquidity mining campaigns.

## **Chain to be deployed/listed**

Aave v3 Prime instance on Ethereum

### **Proof of Liquidity and Deposit Commitments**

Stakeholders in the ecosystem have expressed support for liquidity commitments and incentives. We invite relevant members of the community to provide further details on these during the TEMP CHECK comment phase. 

## Specification

rstETH: [0x7a4EffD87C2f3C55CA251080b1343b605f327E3a](https://etherscan.io/address/0x7a4EffD87C2f3C55CA251080b1343b605f327E3a)

### Risk Parameters:

Initial Risk Parameters will be provided by Risk service providers during the ARFC phase.

## **Useful Links**

[P2P](https://p2p.org)

[Documentation](https://docs.p2p.org)

[Github](https://github.com/p2p-org)

## **Disclaimer**

The Aave Chan Initiative is not directly affiliated with P2P and did not receive compensation for creation this proposal.

## **Next Steps**

1. Period of comment on this TEMP CHECK.
2. TEMP CHECK Snapshot vote for this proposal. 
3. If TEMP CHECK is a YAE, publish a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage.
4. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

## **Copyright**

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

decision.summary: The proposal to deploy Aave v3 on megaETH is strongly supported by voting timeline metrics and market impact is positive. Forum sentiment is cautiously supportive. Historical similar proposals unanimously passed but led to negative market responses, informing cautious optimism.
key_arguments_for: Timeline metrics show unanimous and stable support for 'YAE' option with early voting dominance.
Market impact shows slight positive price (+0.3785%) and TVL (+1.892%) changes.
Forum comments include expressions of support and recognition of megaETH's technical potential.
Similar past proposals passed with overwhelming 'YAE' votes, indicating community preference for expansion.
key_arguments_against: Forum sentiment includes concerns about centralization risks and dependency on new infrastructure.
Historical similar proposals resulted in declines in token price and TVL, suggesting caution.
Limited live testing of megaETH public testnet increases uncertainty.
Some forum comments express caution based on technical claims without live network validation.

evidence.quote: First comment detailed proposal and negative sentiment; second comment positive support; mixed overall sentiment with 1 positive, 2 negative, 3 neutral.
Lead ratio total [1.0, 0.0, 0.0], stability [1.0, 0.0, 0.0], early ratio [1.0, 0.0, 0.0], recommended index 0 (YAE).

evidence.reference: Adjacent proposals with negative market impacts
evidence.quote: Similar past proposals passed but had negative price (-12.3%, -16.2%, -8.3%) and TVL impacts (-9.9%, -5.4%).

decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Voting timeline metrics show unanimous and stable support for YAE.
- Market impact is positive for price and TVL, indicating initial community confidence.
- Forum sentiment is mixed but overall supportive, with some concerns about infrastructure risks.
- Historical similar proposals passed but led to negative market outcomes, advising cautious optimism in moving forward.
- The recommendation aligns with forum sentiment and maximizes long-term benefits by cautiously embracing innovation while noting risks.
